entry.title: Re: Two different subtotals for a Rebate condition contract
entry.content:
Hi @HariBoyapati2, 

It's not standard to have more than 1 subtotal used per contract based on material type or other. 
Regarding the amount field group split, I would recommend to try it in dev/sandbox environment to see the impact (as any configuration in CCM or other module, you get experience by experimenting and hands on). 

In the meantime, here is the description provided by SAP for Group of Split criteria used for Total amount as per Split:

Controls which split criteria the system applies to determine the amount for the Target Condition Type for Total Amount as per Split Criteria and for the Target Condition Type Total Amount as per Split, Second Side.
Use
The purpose of this group of split criteria is to reduce the number of required customizing objects (profiles for business volume determination and condition contract types) in case that you want to use different split criteria for the determination of the total amount as per split criteria.
The control involves three steps.
• You define groups of split criteria used for total amounts as per split.
• In the Amount Fields - Split Criteria dialog structure of a profile for business volume determination you assign different split criteria to a group of split criteria in connection with the target condition types for the total amount as per split criteria on the primary and second side of the settlement document.
• When you create a new condition contract for a condition contract type that uses the contemplated profile, you specify the split criteria group on the Settlement Data tab page of the condition contract header.
Conclusion: In the settlement run for this condition contract, the system uses those split criteria for the determination of the total amount as per split criteria which you have assigned to the split criteria group specified in the condition contract header.

For your requirement, you could check to capture the correct subtotal directly in 1 fields (e.g. For Material type ABC, KZWI1 = KZWI1, for Material type BCD KZWI1 = KZWI2) in the CDS view used for the profile of business volume. 
However, here are some warnings if you plan to do that: 

  • Logic for subtotal determination should be defined and stable (not per contract created, e.g. customer 1 = logic A and customer 2 = logic B). 
  • You're not posting accrual in the transactional documents, if not the system may calculate Accrual based on Subtotal 1 but for this item it should be based on Subtotal 2. 
  • Audit: You should be able to explain clearly how it's calculated for any Audit control/request. Please check with Audit team prior.

Option 1 provided by @MichaelWerner can be another option but may required some tricks in the pricing procedure + more maintenance in the condition record side within the contract - depend heavily on the requirements.  

Regards, 
Gauthier VICTOR

entry.title: Re: Introducing the Gantt Chart Custom Widget for SAP Analytics Cloud
entry.content:
Hello @AEG ,

In your case, the technical IDs are IGCPREXID, IGCPREXID__IGCPLEDDT, IGCPREXID__IGCPLSTDT, and IGCPREXID__IGCRPPHAS. Since you are working only with dates, the Gantt Chart should work without any issues.

The Dataset Parsing Settings mapping should be configured as follows:

  • Event ID: IGCPREXID.id

  • Event Name: IGCPREXID.description

  • Event Description (optional): IGCPREXID.description

  • Event Start Time: IGCPREXID__IGCPLSTDT.id

  • Event End Time: IGCPREXID__IGCPLEDDT.id

  • Parent ID (optional): IGCPREXID__IGCRPPHAS.id

    • Use this only if you need a hierarchical representation and the field references the parent project ID.

    • If a hierarchy is not required, keep the default value Parent_ID.

  • Color of Event Bar (optional): Color

    • Leave this as the default value, since there is no color information in your model.

@andreasja_schneider, many thanks for your inputs.

entry.title: Re: Multiple payment method for one open AP
entry.content:
Good day @ChinYeeChia 

Thank you for your question

In the public cloud one payment document can only have one payment method. That means in your case you cannot clear 30,000 by bank transfer and 70,000 by BoE within the same clearing transaction. So, the best practice is for you to use two separate payment documents, each with its own payment method, both clearing the same invoice. See below link on supplier invoice creation: https://help.sap.com/docs/SAP_S4HANA_CLOUD/0e602d466b99490187fcbb30d1dc897c/01060a2e758f4e8a9d4a7cf07b0ce323.html?locale=en-US and posting General Journal Entries: https://help.sap.com/docs/SAP_S4HANA_CLOUD/0fa84c9d9c634132b7c4abb9ffdd8f06/950f8054747b053de10000000a441470.html?locale=en-US

My recommendation on how to pay one invoice with bank transfer & BoE, is to:

  • Post a partial 30,000 USD payment with the “bank transfer” method, and
  • Clear the remaining 70,000 USD with a BoE document by using the BoE Process.

Both will ensure you fully clear the same supplier invoice, and each carries its own payment method.

Below is a step-by-step approach you may consider:

Step 1: In your manual payment app, enter your bank account, company code, currency and payment method for the bank transfer.

Then select the supplier and then your open invoice of 100,000 USD. Enter 30,000 USD payment amount and post document

This will partially clear the invoice with the bank transfer payment method. The remaining open amount on the invoice is now 70,000 USD.

Step 2: Use your BoE process/app (this will depend on the country you have activated or your BoE scope) to create a bill of Exchange and reference the same supplier invoice.

  • Reference the vendor and the particular invoice
  • Enter 70,000 USD as the amount to be cleared
  • Choose BoE as payment method and post the BoE document

This will clear the remaining 70,000 UD on the invoice. You will then have both amounts split accordingly.

Let me know if you have further questions.

 

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: SAP Fieldglass Sandbox Environment Refresh: 5 Tips for Success
entry.content:
Refreshing your sandbox environment with current production data keeps testing, troubleshooting, and training accurate and realistic. But there are important considerations and data privacy safeguards you need to know before scheduling a refresh. Here are 5 tips to help ensure your sandbox environment refreshes are smooth, timely, and successful.

1. Know Your Refresh Limits

Your sandbox edition determines how many refreshes you can request each year and the maximum data slice you can include in each refresh.

 

Edition

Annual Refresh Limit per Sandbox

Maximum Data Slice

Base Edition

Up to 2 refreshes annually

6 months of Production data (can be less)

Premium Edition

Up to 4 refreshes annually

1 year of Production data

(can be less)

Learn more about base and premium sandbox environments on the SAP Help Portal.

2. Provide 30 Days’ Notice

All production data refresh requests must be scheduled via SAP for Me at least 30 days in advance of your desired refresh date. This lead time ensures resources are available and helps avoid delays to your project or testing cycles.

3. Plan Your Timing Strategically

With limited annual refreshes, align them with your highest priorities, such as:

  • Before major product releases or integration testing
  • Ahead of critical training sessions
  • After significant business process changes or migrations

4. Follow Post-Refresh Best Practices

Once the environment refresh is complete:

  • Validate critical data, configurations, and integrations
  • Reapply sandbox-only settings (for example, test user roles, custom scripts)
  • Notify your team when the environment is ready for use

5. Understand Data Anonymization

To protect personal and confidential information, certain PII fields are anonymized during every sandbox refresh, including in customer-paid sandboxes. This includes the following fields:

  • Email
  • Address
  • Phone number
  • LinkedIn profile URL
  • Resume name
  • Ariba Network ID (ANID) for Supplier and Buyer

It is also important to note, the following PII fields are not anonymized in the sandbox environments, including customer-paid sandboxes, by default. However, you can request SAP Fieldglass Support to anonymize these fields by submitting a case via SAP for Me or the SAP Fieldglass Help Center:

  • First Name
  • Last Name
  • Display Name
  • Company Name
  • Company Street Address

Make sure to check out the SAP Help Portal to learn more about data security.

In summary, using these quick reminders will help you get the most out of your sandbox refreshes. With thoughtful scheduling and clear post-refresh checks, you can ensure your sandbox is accurate, secure, and ready to support your most critical initiatives without wasting any time.

Don’t forget to explore the SAP Help Portal for more information on the SAP Fieldglass Sandbox Environment Landscape.

entry.title: SAC Story Bookmark. Unable to save a bookmark.
entry.content:
Issue with bookmarks. Unable to save bookmark error message. 
In log (Developer Tools) a message appears: We can’t have another bookmark with the name … in this target resource. 

There are no bookmarks in the story self however. 

Reason was in the Bookmarks version which was changed, what caused all old bookmarks to be invalidated, but not deleted. Means the bookmarks are still in the background, but not visible for the user in the Story self.

Go to Story \ Bookmarks, choose Invalid bookmarks and delete.

entry.title: Re: QR- Bill Process from SD Invoice to FI Clearing via C...
entry.content:
Good day @FelixSchwarzIGB 

Thank you for your question

Swiss QR Bill printing and automatic clearing are standard capabilities in the public cloud but they depend on the following being correct at the same time:

  1. The invoice must carry a usable payment reference for the QR Bill process which is typically the payment reference field KIDNO on the customer line item.
  2. The CAMT file must contain that same reference in the remittance or structured reference so the interpretation and search logic can find the open item.

To answer your question regarding clearing logic:

Answer on Storage: Yes, you should expect the full QR reference to be available for clearing search and the standard place is the payment reference on the customer open item. SAP does support configuring search logic that can use other references but if KIDNO is empty that will usually reduce the results rate and you will have more manual work. See links below for more insights:

https://help.sap.com/docs/SAP_S4HANA_CLOUD/ee9ee0ca4c3942068ea584d2f929b5b1/61752f6774614b0f8c637d9a305ab798.html?locale=en-US&version=2508.00

https://help.sap.com/docs/SAP_S4HANA_CLOUD/bb9f1469daf04bd894ab2167f8132a1a/13c22c58f5809344e10000000a4450e5.html?locale=en-US

If you need to influence how the QR Bill reference is generated or adjusted, you should use the released QR Bill extensibility option for Switzerland. This explains how you can change the payment reference number KIDNO as part of the QR Bill processing. See link below for further details:

https://help.sap.com/docs/SAP_S4HANA_CLOUD/6833660c7722498fb41584b098420f89/32d90e4b974742a69316c573e8cd3cb5.html?locale=en-US

Answer on FI document not showing QR reference in KIDNO: There could be a few reasons for that, such as:

  1. The process you use to create invoice is not actually triggering the creation logic for the QR Bill reference.
  2. You are looking at a UI that, by default does not display the field, while the value may still exist on the customer line item.
  3. The reference might ben generated for output but the QR Bill configuration is not aligned to your invoice scenario.

I suggest as a next step to validate it on the customer line item in the Journal entry and not only on the printed form preview.

Answer on Dunning QR reference: Generally, SAP supports dunning notices that include QR Bill data. The system generates the reference on the dunning noticed and it is used to match incoming payments back to the relevant open items by the pre-configured logic without you being required to store that dunning reference on every original FI document line. In public cloud you typically validate this through the dunning apps and the bank statement processing results rather than you carrying out a table inspection. See the following reference for more insights: https://help.sap.com/docs/SAP_S4HANA_CLOUD/6833660c7722498fb41584b098420f89/591a0ee25e2941308fe03fd90842e072.html?locale=en-US

Answer on CAMT.053 and CAMT.054: Yes, you do not need by default both of them. One format is sufficient if it contains the needed reference information and your process timing is met. Typically, CAMT.053 is used for end of day statements while CAMT.054 is for intraday or detailed notifications. In public cloud bank statement processing supports you to import CAMT formats through the Manage Incoming Payment Files process. See below link for more insights: https://help.sap.com/docs/SAP_S4HANA_CLOUD/6833660c7722498fb41584b098420f89/ee71eb0cd10b4843968ea046701e3b7c.html?locale=en-US

https://help.sap.com/doc/ce01d82756b947a1a043a5d5a3204226/2402.503/de-DE/WN_CE2402.3_DE.pdf

In summary, for you to enable reliable automatic clearing for Swiss QR invoices in the public cloud, your invoice must carry a usable payment reference, which is the KIDNO and your CAMT.053 or CAMT.054 entry must contain the same QR reference in the remittance or structured reference. The fact that the bank reports credits on the main CHF account statement can be acceptable but only if the CAMT entry includes the QR reference so Switzerland interpretation and search priorities can match the open item.

Let me know if you have further questions.

 

Best regards

Chris

Header Information

Since exceptions represent error situations, and this error was not

An exception has occurred in class "CX_XCO_GEN_PUT_EXCEPTION". As this exception was not
caught, a runtime error occurred. The reason for the exception
occurring was:
PUT operation failed.

Information on where terminated

The termination occurred in ABAP program or include "CL_XCO_GEN_O_PUT_ABSTRACT=====CP", in "IF_XCO_GEN_O_PUT~EXECUTE". The
main program was "SAPMHTTP".

In the source code, the termination point is in line 9 of include "CL_XCO_GEN_O_PUT_ABSTRACT=====CM008".
include "CL_XCO_GEN_O_PUT_ABSTRACT=====CM008".

Source Code Extract

12345678>1011121314
  METHOD if_xco_gen_o_put~execute.
    DATA(lo_ongoing_operation) = create_ongoing_operation( ).
 
    DATA(lo_action) = get_staging( lo_ongoing_operation
      )->get_action( ).
    lo_action->execute( ).
 
    IF lo_action->succeeded NE xco=>boolean->true OR lo_ongoing_operation->has_failed( ) EQ abap_true.

entry.title: SAP WM- SAP creating TOs with incorrect batch quantity
entry.content:
Hello! I'm assisting client with SAP WM issue in ECC 6.0.   There is a program in place for warehouse users to generate a suggested batch pick list for outbound deliveries.  The pick list data corresponds to a Transfer Order created by the program in the background and is based on the materials and quantities from the  sales order/delivery and the suggested batches/bins are based on our SPRO configuration for the stock removal strategy. All pretty standard stuff. 

The problem is the pick list and related transfer order recently started suggesting random partial quantities of batches  instead of full quantities of batches. For example: Delivery requires 4,000 pcs of material 1A, and a full quantity batch of material 1A is 2,000 pcs. Instead of suggesting two 2,000 pcs full batches of material 1A, the TO  may create for 1,000 pcs from four different full batches of material 1A.   The customer requirement is to ship the full amount of each batch, so this is a problem.

When debugging with team dev, he says the decision to pick partial quantities is coming from the standard SAP programming, not the Z program. We have a small team, and no one states they've made any changes recently to cause this.  I've searched through the Logistics Execution configuration and cant find the problem, which is only occurring in production environment, not in QA or development, as we have tried to reproduce many times and cannot. The entire qty on each batch is created at the same time, so it isn't a FIFO matter.  Has anyone encountered this issue before? What are we overlooking in config that should be changed/investigated?

entry.title: Re: S4 Public Cloud Custom RF verification
entry.content:
Good day @sshetty08 

Thank you for your question

To summarise, yes, the public cloud offers this possibility but only within the standard extensibility and configuration option that is released for Warehouse Management and barcode scanning.

  • You can configure your system to parse barcodes and derive business fields such as product, batch, HU or serial from them by using barcode parsing configuration and GS1 based standards. See the following reference for more insights: https://help.sap.com/docs/SAP_S4HANA_CLOUD/32da8359c8ee4e8b8e8c5e15cacba5aa/dcc5840b808f4de989a93a02ece18e1b.html?locale=en-US
  • You can also enforce scanning and verification behaviour on RF screens by using verification profiles and their determination.  See KBA 3351672 for more details.

However, the public cloud does not allow you to implement a custom ABAP user exit style logic on RF field level except there is a released BAdI or extension point for it by SAP.

So, for your example where supplier barcode contains multiple embedded fields, not only product, i suggest you:

  • First try to solve it with barcode parsing rules.
  • Alternatively, you can then apply RF verification profiles to enforce that the decoded value is checked during the RF process.

This blog contains some useful insights: Extensibility Approaches in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition

 

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: Re: How to translate Name and Description for Custom Business Configuration

entry.title: Re: Deletion of Scope Items
entry.content:
Hi!

After the scope items are selected and the Define Scope activity is completed, it is not possible to delete them from the workspace.

However, as long as the workspace has not been deployed to the Target System, you still have the option to delete the workspace and recreate it without selecting the undesired scope items.

For more details, please refer to the KBA 3255117 - Not possible to delete scope items (scenarios) after activating it - SAP for Me

You can find instructions on how to delete a workspace in Working with Workspaces | SAP Help Portal.

Best regards,

Dear SAP Community Katowice Members,

We are pleased to invite you to the next SAP Stammtisch in Katowice, an informal networking meeting dedicated to exchanging experiences, discussing current SAP topics, and strengthening connections within our local community.

The SAP Stammtisch is a relaxed, open event and a great opportunity to meet fellow SAP professionals, share insights from ongoing projects, and stay connected with what’s happening in the SAP ecosystem.

📅 Date: Wednesday, 4 February 2026
🕕 Time: 18:00
📍 Venue: Café Kattowitz, Katowice
(the same location as our previous Stammtisch)

In addition to networking, we would like to use this meeting to open a discussion with the Community about ideas for future SAP-related initiatives in our region. We would like to talk about how we can encourage each other to closer collaboration, increase engagement, and gain stronger support from our employers. In short, our goal is to make SAP Community Katowice more active and visible, and we believe this can only be achieved through interesting initiatives and the involvement of all community members.

Whether you are an experienced SAP expert or just starting your journey, you are very welcome to join us. There is no formal agenda — just open discussion, shared ideas, and a friendly atmosphere.

Please confirm your participation by selecting “I will attend”, which will help us plan the event and encourage others to join.

We look forward to meeting you again and shaping the future of our community together in 2026.

Kind regards, and see you soon!

If you are not a member of the Katowice Group, please feel invited to join us: SAP Community Katowice

entry.title: SAP Developer News December 18th, 2025
entry.content:

  • Webinars on “SAP TechEd Takeaways: Unlocking Agentic AI with Joule Studio in SAP Build”: https://event.on24.com/eventRegistration/EventLobbyServlet?target=reg20.jsp&eventid=5132226&sessionid=1&key=68EAF8F96311AF0C06B557E4B6FAADAD&groupId=6438260&partnerref=sapcom&sourcepage=register 
  • Maria on “Unlocking SAP BTP” Podcast: https://pod.link/990578446/episode/ODE0OGVkZGMtMWQyNy00ZDVlLTgxMDYtODI0YjYyZWY4NTYz?view=apps&sort=popularity (podcast) and https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=7-DWT6qd15I(YouTube) 
  • Customer use case for building agent for procurement process: https://www.sap.com/assetdetail/2025/12/ecad099c-317f-0010-bca6-c68f7e60039b.html

  • Setting Up Joule Studio for All Customer Flows and Entitlement Levels (blog): https://community.sap.com/t5/technology-blog-posts-by-sap/setting-up-joule-studio-for-all-customer-flows-and-entitlement-levels/ba-p/14240537 

ABAP Holiday Calendar 2025 

  • LinkedIn Post https://www.linkedin.com/pulse/abap-holiday-calendar-2025-sonja-li%25C3%25A9nard-wampe/  

GenAI Hub now officially LLM provider for LiteLLM 

  • Documentation: https://sap-contributions.github.io/litellm-agentic-examples/ 
  • Devtoberfest Session on LiteLLM: https://community.sap.com/t5/devtoberfest/connect-to-generative-ai-hub-with-litellm-and-build-ai-agents-with-crewai/ev-p/14217011 

New release 1.18 of the Terraform Provider for SAP BTP 

  • Release info https://github.com/SAP/terraform-provider-btp/releases  
  • BTP CLI and APIs CodeJam section on extracting the CF API endpoint value https://github.com/SAP-samples/cloud-btp-cli-api-codejam/blob/main/exercises/05-core-services-api-prep/README.md#extracting-the-api-endpoint-value  

CAP Enterprise Analytics 

  • NPM Package Details: https://www.npmjs.com/package/@sap/cds-analytics 

SAP BTP Cloud Foundry runtime trial restrictions lifted 

  • Carolin’s blog post, updated https://community.sap.com/t5/technology-blog-posts-by-sap/update-btp-trial-update-cf-runtime-availability/ba-p/14247240  

Devtoberfest Winners Interview - Kanika Chhabra 

 

CHAPTER TITLES  

0:00 Intro 

0:10 Joule Studio Agent Builder Released 

2:42 ABAP Holiday Calendar 2025 

2:58 GenAI Hub now officialy LLM provider for LiteLLM 

4:24 New release 1.18 of the Terraform Provider for SAP BTP 

5:18 CAP Enterprise Analytics 

6:02 SAP BTP Cloud Foundry runtime trial restrictions lifted 

6:44 Devtoberfest Winners Interview - Kanika Chhabra 

 

TRANSCRIPTION

[Intro] This is the SAP Developer News for December 18th, 2025.

[Daniel] Tomorrow, Joule Studio is expected to release the much-anticipated Agent Builder, where you can create agents for yourself without coding in order to extend Joule. You provide the instructions on the context, as well as a set of skills and other tools, and the agent will analyze, plan, and execute the appropriate actions all by itself. You can specify the LLM you want to use, how much thinking you want the agent to do, as well as several more settings. Included are several features even the beta participants did not get to see, including Vibe coding, where you can use prompts to build your agent step-by-step. You can connect to an MCP server and bring those skills into your agent. And you can create sub-agents that can be called by your main agent. Maria Kondratyeva, a senior product manager who has been working tirelessly to get this release out the door before Christmas, says that you will incur no additional unit cost through the end of January when you deploy and test your new agents. I will leave a set of links to materials about Joule Studio and the Agent Builder, including documentation, webinars, and Maria's recent appearance on the very popular Unlocking SAP BTP podpass. That's a really nice jingle. All the links are in the description. Now that Joule Studio is complete with the Agent Builder and the Skill Builder, I assume now more than ever you'll want to install Joule Studio and get started. Lucky for you, Product Management, specifically Maria and Charin, have produced two blogs on how to set up Joule Studio, one specifically for partners and one specifically for customers. It will show you the SKUs you need for build and Joule. It'll show you the boosters, the formations, the security setup, the roles, and everything that you need for whatever landscape you're using, and whether or not you've already installed Joule Studio or Joule or Process Automation. Links to both of those blogs are also in the description.

[Shilpa] Christmas is around the corner, and the SAP ABAP team brings you ABAP holiday calendar 2025. Check out the LinkedIn post by Sonia, where she highlights the key achievements in the area of ABAP in this year.

[Nora] I have some really cool news for all the SAP AI developers out there. It's basically an early Christmas gift because my friend from development just reached out to me, they told me that generative AI hub is now an official large language model provider for light LLM. Now what is light LLM? Light LLM is an open source library that basically unifies all the different API calls to the different large language model providers. So if it's compatible now with generative AI hub, that means that you can use all the models that we partner with. You can use generative AI hub and light LLM and then all the cool agent development kits, for example, that are compatible with light LLM, and that is really cool because the list is endless. I have those tier because I can't remember everything. So there's LandGraph, Crew AI, Pydantic AI, Google Agent Development Kit, so ADK, OpenAI ADK, AWS TransAgents, Lama Index, Microsoft Agents, and that's not even the whole list. It goes on and on and on. So make sure you check out the documentation that is linked in the show notes wherever they appear. And then also check out the Devtoberfest session with my colleague Karim, who also linked a GitHub repository, where he shows how you can build your own AI agents with generative AI Hub, LightLLM and Crew AI. And yeah, happy coding over the holidays. Happy holidays and happy coding.

[DJ] The team behind the Terraform provider for SAP BTP has an early holiday season present for us. A new version, 1.18, has just landed, bringing fixes, improvements, and new features. Here are just three of the highlights. So first, resources and data sources for destinations are now available. MTLS authentication for service brokers is now supported and there are also some new functions for extracting information from environment instance labels, if you know you know. Check out the full release details for these and more features. By the way, there's already a patch version 1.18.1 which you should use. Links in the description.

[Tom] This month we see a great new CAP add-in in the form of the SAP enterprise analytics add-in. This cool new little feature brings to CAP the support for INA services or information access. These are particularly useful when you want to consume a service from the SAP Analytics Cloud, particularly if you have a calculation view. It's very easy to use: drop in the record referred to module, NPN module, and then simply add some annotations to your data model. It's that simple to now add INA services. So if you're interested in that functionality, be sure to check it out today.

[DJ] A few weeks back, we had a news item on access being temporarily restricted for SAP BTP Cloud Foundry runtimes in the trial environment. Just a few days ago, the SAP BTP trial product team announced that these restrictions have been lifted again and Cloud Foundry runtimes are now fully available again in trial. That's great news and another early holiday season present for us. A link to Carolyn's original blog post, which now has an update with these details, is in the description.

[Kanika Chhabra] 'm so happy to have one of our winners from Devtoberfest. So give me this car. I did happy day possible. Oh yeah, she take away it out of that. High ah, so many like that. I did not have a lot of tech background but I was able to do the exercises and MPK, so it was really intuitive and everything was really well developed. So I didn't need to have a lot of background knowledge because one cannot know everything about everything. So it was really very made. That's what's really was raised. And now you are here in Berlin, One TechEd. So what did you like most or what you're looking for to get out of here? So I just got a little interested in SAP Build and I found out all the SAP Build hands-on workshops here, and that really helped me. So I do not have a prior experience on that but I started from scratch here working on the SAP Build and I was actually able to learn a lot and now I have a certification made on SAP BuilderXS. Yeah, so I have like exciting about that. Very impressive. Thank you so much.

entry.title: Brazil as One of the Leading Hubs for Artificial Intelligence (2024–2025)
entry.content:
Over the past two years, Brazil has established itself as one of the main Artificial Intelligence (AI) hubs globally, standing out for its combination of public investments, expanding business ecosystem, and regulatory progress. Traditionally a leader in innovation and technology in Latin America, Brazil is now attracting international attention by accelerating the adoption of AI across strategic sectors such as finance, energy, agribusiness, and public services.

In 2024, the Brazilian government launched the Brazilian Artificial Intelligence Plan (PBIA) 2024–2028, a program with an estimated investment of R$ 23 billion dedicated to AI research, development, and infrastructure. The plan aims to strengthen technological sovereignty, foster innovation through universities, and support companies in applying AI to practical use cases, particularly in areas of public interest.

The Main pillars of the PBIA 2024–2028 are:

  • Expansion of AI research and innovation centers;
  • Tax incentives for startups and public–private partnerships;
  • Training and qualification of AI professionals;
  • Implementation of AI in public services (health, security, education).

This initiative positions Brazil as a regional leader in AI policy, ahead of countries like Mexico, Chile, and Argentina.

Brazil’s private sector is undergoing a phase of rapid AI adoption. By 2025, a national survey identified 396 Brazilian AI companies focused on marketing applications, reflecting diversification across generative AI, automation, analytics, and digital services.

According to a Bain & Company (2025) study, 67% of Brazilian companies now consider AI a strategic priority, a major leap from 2024, when only about 12% had active projects. This demonstrates the transition from experimental use to mature, production-level adoption.

Brazil received international investments and technological infrastructure. That's why Brazil’s consolidation as an AI hub also stems from the confidence of major global players. In September 2024, Microsoft announced a US$ 2.7 billion investment in cloud and AI infrastructure in Brazil, one of the largest technology investments in Latin American history. In 2025, Eletrobras partnered with C3 AI to modernize Brazil’s power grid using AI and machine learning, highlighting the industrial applications of advanced technologies.

These moves strengthen Brazil’s position as a regional hub for data and high-performance computing, essential for scaling generative AI and automation initiatives.

Despite major progress, Brazil still faces structural challenges. A SAP Brazil (March 2025) survey revealed that:

  • 29% of companies lack clarity on how to integrate AI into their business systems;
  • 28% cite a shortage of skilled professionals as the main obstacle.

On the regulatory front, Brazil has emerged as a key player. In 2024, the National Data Protection Authority (ANPD) suspended Meta Platforms’ privacy policy, which used Brazilians’ personal data to train generative AI models. This decision marked an important milestone in ethical governance and digital sovereignty, aligning Brazil with European-style data protection principles.

The main sectors driving AI growth in Brazil include:

  • Finance and digital payments: automation and predictive analytics;
  • Energy: smart grids and real-time system optimization;
  • Agribusiness: crop forecasting and climate analytics;
  • Healthcare: assisted diagnostics and telemedicine;
  • Public administration: chatbots and natural language processing for citizen services.

These industries attract investments from both large corporations and local startups, making Brazil a fertile ground for experimentation and innovation.

About the Outlook for 2025 and Beyond the trends indicate continued expansion of generative AI and process automation in Brazilian companies. By the end of 2025, it is expected that:

  • Over 60% of corporate AI solutions in Brazil will involve generative models;
  • The country will consolidate international research and training partnerships;
  • The General Artificial Intelligence Law (under discussion in Congress) will advance the national governance framework.

With growing public and private investments, Brazil is on track to become a Latin American reference in AI innovation and ethics, combining economic growth with responsible technological governance.

The 2024–2025 period marks a strategic turning point for AI in Brazil, shifting from an emerging topic to a core pillar of industrial and business competitiveness. The alignment between government vision, international investments, and technological maturity positions Brazil as one of the leading AI hubs in the Southern Hemisphere, with the potential to export technology, talent, and regulatory best practices.

SAP Financial Apps use AI-powered applications for SAP Finance, focused on enhancing financial visibility and decision-making. We can use leverages data from Supply Chain, Sales, Treasury, Accounts Receivable, Accounts Payable, and real-time Bank Balances to deliver accurate forecasting and scenario simulation, ensuring that financial teams have a clear, data-driven view of their company’s liquidity at any time.

Is your company already exploring AI implementation projects? In which sectors or business processes are you seeing the greatest potential for transformation?

References

  • Reuters: Microsoft to invest $2.7 billion in Brazil
  • Reuters: Brazil proposes $4 billion AI investment plan
  • SAP News Brazil (2025): Brazil leads in AI adoption among enterprises
  • Bain & Company (2025): Artificial Intelligence Adoption Survey
  • Instituto IA – LNCC (2024–2025): Mapping of AI Research Groups in Brazil
  • Poder360 (2024): Brazil to become Latin America’s AI hub with R$ 22 billion by 2028

entry.title: CAP - Hide/Show standard Create/Edit Buttons based on Roles
entry.content:
I have an list report / object page app where only one role has access to the Create/Edit/Delete buttons, other roles have read-only access. Authorisations have been defined in my annotations, however the Create/Edit/Delete buttons still show up in the app UI (pressing on them gives a Forbidden error).

annotate MyService.MyEntity with @(restrict: [
    {
        grant: 'READ',
        to   : ['LimitedRole']
    },
]);

Instead I would prefer to hide/disable those buttons for users with the read only roles. I tried following the example mentioned in the documentation here: https://cap.cloud.sap/docs/advanced/fiori#use-roles-to-toggle-visibility-of-ui-elements

However, I've found some options work and some do not. In terms of disabling buttons, I found that only the DeleteRestrictions has any effect:

annotate MyService.MyEntity with @(Capabilities: {
    // Disable Standard Buttons for non-admin roles (only works for Delete, no effect for Create and Edit)
    InsertRestrictions: {Insertable: {$edmJson: {$Path: '/MyService.EntityContainer/Configuration/isAdmin'}}},
    UpdateRestrictions: {Updatable: {$edmJson: {$Path: '/MyService.EntityContainer/Configuration/isAdmin'}}},
    DeleteRestrictions: {Deletable: {$edmJson: {$Path: '/MyService.EntityContainer/Configuration/isAdmin'}}},
});

In terms of hiding the standard buttons, this is a bit better as it works for both Edit and Delete, however it also does not effect the Create button.

annotate MyService.MyEntity with @(Capabilities: {
    // Hide Standard Buttons for non-admin roles (only works for Edit and Delete, no effect for Create)
    UI.CreateHidden: {$edmJson: {$Not: {$Path: '/CatalogService.EntityContainer/Configuration/isAdmin'}}},
    UI.UpdateHidden: {$edmJson: {$Not: {$Path: '/CatalogService.EntityContainer/Configuration/isAdmin'}}},
    UI.DeleteHidden: {$edmJson: {$Not: {$Path: '/CatalogService.EntityContainer/Configuration/isAdmin'}}},
});

 The strange thing to me is that since it works for Edit and Delete it shows that the path is correct and the isAdmin logic is also working correctly (console.log in the service handler also confirms this). If I hardcode UI.CreateHidden to true or 

InsertRestrictions:{Insertable to false, then both have the desired effect that I'm after.
 
So to me I've confirmed that the properties are correct for what I want to achieve (by hardcoding to true/false and testing), and the dynamic logic is correct in that is works partially for Edit and Delete. However, both annotations for the Create button only seem to work with a hardcoded true or false. Is there something else I'm missing?

entry.title: Re: SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud – Dunning Notice Email to Cu...
entry.content:
Good day @Praveen06 

Thank you for your question

To summarise, your expectation is reasonable but there is an important distinction in the Output Management within the public cloud:

  • The business receiver role for the output item (typically the customer role for dunning) is selected by the receiver determination.
  • One or more email addresses for that output item is then derived by the email recipient determination. While the system supports multiple recipients, getting a list of contact persons usually requires the released enhancement option.

1. On your question about “Is it standard that Contact Person is not selectable in Receiver Role": The answer is yes. The reason is, in the dunning output scenario, the Receiver role list is limited to the roles SAP uses as business receivers for the output item. The system does not typically treat contact persons as separate receiver rile in this step. Instead, the system handles thema as an additional email recipient. See reference for more insights: https://help.sap.com/docs/SAP_S4HANA_CLOUD/918bca53037f408f91a2295d04ac16bc/e616af23d2b947fbb275deb759b7090b.html?locale=en-US

2. On your question about your configuration being sufficient to email the customer and all dunning contact person: It is sufficient to email the customer email, if the customer email is available in the context and you map it in the Email Recipient step. So, if your requirement is to send to all contact persons marked as dunning recipient, then the approach is typically to:

  • Keep your Email Recipient mapping for the customer and
  • Add additional recipients through the released BAdI for additional email recipients.

--> See KBA 2976132 for more details.

3. Regarding the additional prerequisite for multiple contact person emails: I suggest you use the released enhancement option BAdI (APOC_ADD_EMAIL_RECIPIENTS). See more details here: https://help.sap.com/docs/SAP_S4HANA_CLOUD/a630d57fc5004c6383e7a81efee7a8bb/c5b0dbca5f3548aba2979de7a3f380e4.html?locale=en-US & https://help.sap.com/docs/SAP_S4HANA_CLOUD/918bca53037f408f91a2295d04ac16bc/98c23e90e0864287a770eb9c6358b26c.html?locale=en-US . This BAdI returns multiple recipients for one output item. For dunning specifically, the KBA 3517737 provides details on setup.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: Changes to Android Offline Learning Offline Coming in February
entry.content:
If your organization uses the Learning “offline content” feature in the SuccessFactors native Android mobile app, please read on.

What’s Changing

With the February 2026 app update (v16.1.0), we’ll be making foundational changes which affect the on-device database that manages the learner’s downloaded content, offline learning progress, and LMS sync. This has two implications for users who may have content or learning progress saved to their devices at the time the mobile app update is installed.

First, technical limitations prevent content that's currently downloaded to devices from being migrated to the new database. So, any downloaded content will unfortunately be removed from users' devices as part of the app update, and will need to be re-downloaded after the new version of the app has been installed and they’re online.

Equally important, any offline learning progress saved to devices that has not already been synced with LMS, will also not be migrated to the new database. So, users should make sure to sync any offline progress prior to February 16, when the v16.1.0 update will be released to the Play Store and the Tencent store.

 

What Users Should Do

If your organization hasn’t enabled downloadable learning content or your users aren’t actively using offline content on the SuccessFactors native Android app, no action is needed.

For affected users, we recommend syncing learning progress just prior to the release of the app update on February 16, and not completing any further offline learning activities until the new version has been successfully installed on the device.

Syncing offline progress is easy- users only need to open the SuccessFactors app while online, and LMS sync automatically runs in the background. Users will see a success message on-screen once the sync has been completed, which typically takes no more than a few seconds.

If you have users who have been working offline but will be unable to sync their progress prior to the app update, we recommend that app auto-updates be temporarily disabled in their device's operating system settings. When the user is able to come back online, they should launch the SuccessFactors app first, to sync learning progress. Then, after successful sync, they can restore the app store auto-update setting to allow version 16.1.0 to be installed, or manually initiate the update.

Other mobile learning features are not affected by this change, and users can continue to use the apps normally before and after we release the update. Likewise, offline learning in the SuccessFactors iOS app and the dedicated Validated Learning apps are not impacted by this change. Thanks for reading, and please ask any questions in the comments.

 

Related Information

Mobile and Offline Learning

Create Mobile and Offline Learning Content

entry.title: Re: Customer Return(A2X) API and In-House Repair API Comb...
entry.content:
Hello @srinivasareddybhimanadham 

Thank you for your question

  1. Regarding your question on an API availability: No, not as a standard released API
  2. On your question about relationship information: Yes, the relationships exist as mentioned above
  3. Regarding the released CDS views availability: No, there is no single none that delivers your intent.

Below is my explanation

In summary, the public cloud does not provide single standard API that combines Customer Return (A2X) and In House Repair into one object model. There are only process relationships between the two business areas and separate API for each. See following references for more insights:

In House Repair: https://help.sap.com/docs/SAP_S4HANA_CLOUD/6d57d4ab71e5408581e2018320a0ce49/40347a9ad1b54a4b931ea07b54faa42d.html?locale=en-US

Customer Returns: https://help.sap.com/docs/SAP_S4HANA_CLOUD/588780cab2774a7ab9fffca3a7f919fe/807fa67fc625453bad4756e4832f42f5.html?locale=en-US

See a similar community question: https://community.sap.com/t5/enterprise-resource-planning-q-a/relationship-between-in-house-repair-3xk-and-customer-returns-bkp/qaq-p/12656573

I suggest you

  • Use the released APIs (Customer Return A2X and In House Repair side by side.
  • Use the standard process integration between return and repair. This Blog provides some insights: In-House Repair in S/4HANA Service - Start with an Overview
  • You may consider using Service Order APIs as the linking object when needed. See the following reference for more details: https://help.sap.com/docs/SAP_S4HANA_CLOUD/6d57d4ab71e5408581e2018320a0ce49/6e59e3179c924b4f8f8df9bf2569aa9d.html?locale=en-US

 

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: Re: Error When Generating DOC via “Run Statutory Reports”...
entry.content:
Good day @Yaya_AB 

Thank you for your question

The fact that you performed the same process /Test in your test system without errors but the client gets the Generation failed error could be based on a few factors. I suggest you check if:

  • There are missing business catalog or lack of authorisation for report run objects on your client’s side. The reason is, the functionality depends on both tenant and user. Which often differs between Test and Prod. See KBA 3587016 for more insights.
  • The statutory reporting configuration in the prod tenant is complete. For example, reporting entity, assignments or your FEC setup might be inconsistent. See reference below for more details:

https://help.sap.com/docs/SAP_S4HANA_CLOUD/33b132c0121c41f3b412258173d76b0d/358fb318c9cc4ceb8299135ec2c03a6f.html?locale=en-US

https://help.sap.com/docs/SAP_S4HANA_CLOUD/33b132c0121c41f3b412258173d76b0d/e937bec0b2b94d628c71b7bb95b91aa5.html?locale=en-US

  • The error is generated because of data volume or your runtime issue which might lead to a backend error. See KBA 3575645 for some instances.
  • The run technically created something but the file it produced cannot be downloaded or is empty.

I suggest you capture the run log and the background job log first, then you validate statutory reporting setup and user catalogs in your client’s productive system.

 

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: Re: Archiving Custom Database Tables in SAP Public Cloud
entry.content:
I assume you want to use the archiving framework provided by SAP.
First you should define whether you want to archive for volume management (without ILM) or rather data destruction (with ILM) based on retention period and if the released API covers your requirements. According to the documentation, both can be used for custom tables. Have you tried the example implementations?
Both variants eventually use the Archive Development Kit (ADK) API to store the archive file in the storage system - compressed as binary data. You cannot decide the format. You need ABAP Logic to deserialize the binary data. There is no option to store it in a human readable, structured format.
As far as I know, the REST API of DMS does not support reading stored files with offset (length). Therefore I would not recommend using it because ADK likes to read in small packages. For SAP Archiving objects, the storage system is now SAP HANA Cloud, Data Lake Files (HDLF). Therefore I would recommend HDLF as the storage system for your custom archive objects.
In the volume management variant you need to implement a storage manager. This is the interface for ADK to the storage system. In your custom storage manager implementation you can call any storage system you like.
Unfortunately, we don't have an example implementation of a custom storage manager for HDLF but we are working on it. Basically you call the REST API of the storage system and send the archive file which is handed over by ADK to the storage manager.

entry.title: Clean Core maturity and the new Extensibility Levels
entry.content:
For years, the architectural conversation around SAP S/4HANA seemed trapped in a rigid side.
On one side, the purist vision moving all development to side-by-side extensibility on SAP BTP. On the other side, the operational reality, where complex transactional logic and proximity to data made decoupling code technically expensive and sometimes unfeasible..

However, we often lost in this conversation: Clean Core... what's side-by-side... what's On-stack
Not so far back in time, we followed the 3-Tier Development Model. This framework tried to organize development into three tiers (Tier 1 for Cloud, Tier 2 with Wrappers, Tier 3 for Legacy).

While useful, there's a new pragmatic second generation framework: the Clean Core Level Concept
This new maturity model increases the availability of APIs and reduces the forced need for wrappers, incorporating classic ABAP use cases safely. But how does this translate into the modern architecture of Levels A, B, C, and D?

Level A: The Gold Standard (On-stack & Side-by-side)
Level A doesn't force you off-stack. It represents extensions that rely exclusively on stable, public interfaces backed by stability. Is agnostic to the deployment environment:

Side-by-side Extensions: Decoupled extensions running on the Business Technology Platform. This ecosystem allows for SAP Build (low-code/pro-code), CAP (Java/Node.js), and ABAP Cloud (Steampunk) to create scalable apps and automations

On-stack Extensions: Created inside SAP S/4HANA Cloud (either as Key User Extensions or Developer Extensions). This validates that building tightly coupled logic within the S/4HANA it's ok, provided that released technologies like RAP (RESTful ABAP Programming) and CDS Views are used. So that by using of released APIs and strict syntax checks, you can build tightly coupled logic (essential for transactional integrity) without creating technical debt

Level B: The Pragmatism of "Classic APIs"
Unlike Level A, which relies on stability contracts, Level B uses Classic APIs and frameworks. While not strictly "Cloud" capable, these are nominated by SAP product experts as upgrade-stable.

You can identify these in the Cloudification Repository. Object frameworks such as SAPscript, and ALE/IDoc integrations fall into this category. This provides a critical "safe harbor," allowing to leverage proven legacy technologies without facing immediate refactoring pressure

Level C: Risk Management and Changelogs
When business reality demands the use of internal SAP objects for legacy scenarios, we enter Level C. Unlike the previous levels, there is an upgrade risk here. To mitigate it, SAP provides the Changelog for SAP Objects, a tool that allows you to identify incompatible changes early and plan proactive actions. Although not the preferred approach, it is a valid option if managed with wrappers to isolate the dependency.

Level D : The red line (Technical Debt)
Any extension that uses non-recommended techniques, such as direct modifications to the standard, direct writing to tables, or Implicit Enhancements, falls into this category. This represents the highest risk of technical debt and must be rigorously blocked using ABAP Test Cockpit (ATC) checks. These patterns bypass standard logic and guarantee disruption during upgrades

Extensions objects are classified as unfit for customer use (marked as "noAPI" in the Cloudification Repository) 

By understanding Levels (A, B, C, D) we can make architectural decisions that balance technical purity with operational reality, prioritizing business stability and flexibility.... But Important!!: Beyond the levels, a Clean Core strategy requires governance. The fundamental principle is: Extensions must be avoided when possible. Before, we must to evaluate if standard functionality covers the process. If the extension is inevitable, we must ensure that extensions don't break Upgrades
To decide between an On-stack or Side-by-side implementation, customers should use the SAP Application Extension Methodology. This methodology helps to define a custom extension strategy. It addresses challenges like "clean core" by offering a structured, standard approach. This ensures a common understanding and terminology and it allows to assess technical options and make informed decisions to build an extension framework for your organization.

---
Bookmark this SAP Note: 3578329 - Frameworks, Technologies and Development Patterns in Context of Clean Core Extensibility 
Official list of framework and technology classifications that will tell you what is Level A, B, C, or D

New Cloudification Repository Viewer for Clean Core Governance and Development
https://community.sap.com/t5/technology-blog-posts-by-sap/new-cloudification-repository-viewer-for-clean-core-governance-and/ba-p/14236110

entry.title: Re: Employee Central - Business Rule to default country i...
entry.content:
Hi @mkrieg,

Yes, you can write a simple rule to check for the specific legal entities (for which the rule should be triggered) and make the country field non-editable. If the number of those LEs is small, then you can put them in the rule itself, or you can create a custom MDF object to maintain the LEs. If the employee's LE is matched, then the rule defaults the country field from the jobInfo record. 

You might have to consider the following:

- You might have to create an onSave rule, as an onInit rule might not be triggered on homeAddress.

- In specific scenarios, the employee's home address country might be different from the LE country.

- You might have to handle Global assignment and concurrent employment cases, if applicable.

Regards,

Jayendra

entry.title: Re: Why Excluded Filters in BW query not working in sap a...
entry.content: Yes this is by design in SAP Analytics Cloud because in live BW on HANA connections excluded filters are fully respected in tables but charts handle filter evaluation differently during aggregation, so excluded selections from the BW query may appear ignored in charts, and this is a known limitation of chart rendering in live BW scenarios, with the usual workaround being to redesign the BW query filter logic, use restricted key figures, or validate results using tables instead of charts.

entry.title: Re: Unposted values in SAP Analytics Cloud Headmap
entry.content: In SAP Analytics Cloud heatmaps do not support unposted or unbooked values for live BW queries because heatmaps require fully aggregated posted data for color calculation, while tables can display unposted values directly from the query result set, so this is a known limitation by design and there is no workaround other than using a table or posting the data.

entry.title: Leveraging AI for a perfect SAP case ticket creation in SAP For Me
entry.content:
This is a two parts blog articulating the effective use of AI tools for perfect SAP case ticket creation, for getting the best value from SAP Support Services.

Part 1:  Leveraging AI tools for a perfect SAP case ticket creation

Part 2: Leveraging AI tools for effective business impact driven priortization

In Part 2,  let's explore how to leverage AI tools for crafting an effective business impact statement for right prioritization and triaging for speedy processing of P1-Very High and P2-High tickets.

SAP for Me has transitioned to an Impact-Driven Prioritization model where your business impact statement directly determines your ticket's priority level. Using AI tools like Joule or external LLMs (e.g., ChatGPT, Perplexity, Claude) can help you draft these statements to meet SAP's stringent requirements and avoid resolution delays. 

  1. Structure Your AI Prompt

To generate a perfect statement, provide your AI agent with these core data points based on SAP's mandatory criteria: 

  • System Status: Is the system completely unavailable or just a specific module?
  • Business Process: Which specific process is stopped (e.g., monthly payroll run, year-end closing)?
  • Quantifiable Impact: How many users are affected? What is the estimated financial loss per day?
  • Deadlines: Are there impending legal or project go-live deadlines (include exact dates)?
  • Workaround: State clearly if a workaround exists and why it is not feasible for long-term use.

2. AI-Assisted Writing within SAP for Me

When creating a case in the Get Support application:

  • Text Prompts: Use the integrated AI text prompts to guide your input. These prompts are designed to extract the most relevant details for SAP engineers.
  • Categorization: AI predictor services in SAP for Me analyze your short description to automatically recommend the correct product component, ensuring your impact statement reaches the right expert team immediately.

3. Checklist for High/Very High (Critically Affected) Priority

For critical cases, your AI-generated statement must include these "non-negotiable" details to maintain the priority level:

  • 24/7 Contact: Provide a primary and secondary contact available 24/7 who can speak English.
  • Quantified Financials: Instead of saying "major impact," use AI to calculate quanitified financial loss to the business: "Issue affects 500+ employees and delays a $2M monthly billing cycle".
  • Project Milestones: For non-production systems, clearly list the Go-Live date and explain if the issue is a "showstopper" for that milestone.

4. Sample AI Prompt for a Support Case

Copy and adapt this prompt for your AI assistant:

"Write a professional  SAP Business Impact statement for a 'Critically Affected' support ticket. The issue is that the [Module Name] is not generating [Specific Document Type]. It affects [Number] of users. Our go-live date is [Date], and this is a showstopper because [Reason]. There is no workaround. Financial impact is estimated at $[Amount] per day".

4. Essential SAP Documentation

For further guidance on priority definitions and case management, refer to these official resources:

  • SAP Note 67739: Official definitions for priority levels (Low to Very High).
  • SAP Note 1281633: How to speed up the processing of a case.

Optimize and transform the way SAP Support tickets are raised with the aid of AI but with caution and responsiblity.

entry.title: Leveraging AI for a perfect SAP case ticket creation in SAP For Me
entry.content:
This is a two parts blog articulating the effective use of AI tools for perfect SAP case ticket creation, for getting the best value from SAP Support Services.

Part 1:  Leveraging AI tools for a perfect SAP case ticket creation

Part 2: Leveraging AI tools for effective business impact driven priortization

In Part 1, let us explore innovative ways for creating a perfect SAP SuccessFactors support case which involves leveraging SAP's latest Support assistant (powered by AI), Joule, and the SAP for Me ecosystem to automate the technical details that support engineers need. 

  1. Leverage the SAP Check Tool

Before manually drafting a ticket, use the built-in Check Tool to identify and classify issues automatically. 

  • Run the Check: Navigate to Admin Center > Check Tool and execute the relevant tests for your module (e.g., Employee Central, Recruiting).
  • Direct Ticket Creation: If the tool finds an error it cannot resolve, select the "Need Assistance?" section on the Result tab to create a case directly.
  • Automatic Data Capture: Creating a ticket this way automatically attaches critical Component IDs (e.g., LOD-SF-EC) and system logs, ensuring the case is routed to the correct expert immediately. 

2. Use Support Assistant for Problem Description 

When writing the "Problem Description" in the SAP for Me portal, either use any external AI-assisted writing tool to refine your text for clarity or use the inbuilt Support Assistant. In the SAP for Me portal, the Support Assistant/Get Support feature is an AI-enabled, conversational guided tool designed to suggest solutions, classify problems, and recommend the best channel (like Expert Chat, Schedule an Expert, or creating a Case) for faster resolution.

 Structure Your Input: Provide the AI agent with these four essential elements:

    • Specific Issue: "All applicants fail to receive emails when moved to 'Hired' status".
    • Expected Behavior: "Candidates should receive configured email notifications based on the Applicant Status Configuration".
    • Step-by-Step Replication: Ask the AI to format your notes into a numbered list (e.g., "1. Log into test environment; 2. Proxy as User X; 3. Move Candidate Y...").
    • Business Impact: Clearly define if the issue is Minimally, Moderately, Seriously, or Critically effected. Refer to the blog's Part 2 for crafting an effective Business Impact using effective AI Prompting for critically effected issues.

3. Provide Mandatory Technical Context 

Provide these mandatory details to prevent "back-and-forth" delays: 

  • Instance Details: Include your Data Center, Company ID, and specific Client/System ID.
  • User Details: Provide the specific User ID or Candidate Name used for testing.
  • Visual Evidence: Attach uncropped screenshots that show the full browser address bar to help SAP engineers verify your environment.

4. Ensure "Premium AI" Support Readiness (New for 2025)

If your issue specifically involves SAP’s new generative AI features (e.g., Joule or SAP Generative AI Use cases), verify your setup: 

  • Premium Features: Check if your usage exceeds your annual allocation, as these are classified as "Premium AI" features.
  • Permissions: Confirm that the "Manage AI Capabilities" permission is active in Role-Based Permissions (RBP), as this is often required for support to investigate AI-specific failures. 

Hope this blog details how to effectively use SAP’s AI assistant and Check Tool for creating support tickets and ensuring proper context is provided for a speedy processing by Support Engineers, thereby significantly minimising the overall ticket processing time.  👉 Click here for reading Part 2 of the blog.

entry.title: Re: SAP BW BEx query structures replication/creation in S...
entry.content: SAP Analytics Cloud does not support direct replication of SAP BW BEx query structures inside a story because structures are handled at BW query level, so the same behavior can be achieved only by creating equivalent restricted or calculated measures in the BW query or SAC model, or by redesigning the logic using measures, filters, and charts in SAC, as there is no one to one structure concept available in SAC stories.

entry.title: SAP Integrated Business Planning On Demand - Stay Secure with SAP EarlyWatch Alert
entry.content:
With SAP Integrated Business Planning On Demand, SAP takes care of many security-related topics as cloud provider. However, in order to stay secure, customers are still responsible for the mitigation of risks such as business or technical users having critical authorizations.

Here, the SAP EarlyWatch Alert report in SAP for Me comes into play as it gives you insights into security risks in the chapter "Security (SAP IBP OD)". This chapter provides insights and alerts you on the following topics:

  • Assignment of Users to Business Role SAP_BR_ADMINISTRATOR - check for usage of this role in production, leading to segregation of duties (SoD) conflicts as it is intended only for initial system configuration
  • Use of Read/Write Unrestricted - get alerts on business roles with unrestricted write, read and value help access, allowing users global data access
  • Critical Business Catalog Assignment - be warned about over-assignment of critical authorizations which should have limited use in production
  • Critical Authorization Combinations - get alerts for users assigned excess authorizations through critical combinations of business catalogs
  • Communication (Inbound/Outbound) - get alerts on customer-managed communication arrangements based on user/password authentication, where certificate-based authentication is more secure
  • Upcoming Certificate Expiration - get early warnings for customer-managed certificates which will expire within the next 90 days

You can find more details on each of these chapters below or by directly accessing the SAP EarlyWatch Alert report* for your systems in SAP for Me. 
* an authorized user is needed to access this application - refer to this SAP Support page on how to get access.

Assignment of Users to Business Role SAP_BR_ADMINISTRATOR

The role SAP_BR_ADMINISTRATOR is predefined by SAP and is intended only for the initial configuration of a system. Using this role in production is not recommended by SAP and may lead to compliance issues. This section checks the role's usage and points to in-depth information on Identity Access Management. It provides a link to the procedure for creating a more restricted administration role, suitable for use in production.

Use of Read/Write Unrestricted

Using unrestricted fields in the maintenance of business roles allow users to have global data access. SAP best practices recommend to carefully review which users need to have restricted data access and maintain the access appropriately, e.g. ensuring employees only have access to data belonging to their sales organization. This chapter includes the number of business roles with unrestricted write, read or value help access, and describes the related SAP Fiori app Maintain Business Roles.

Use of Read/Write Unrestricted Table Example

 

Critical Business Catalog Assignment

Business catalogs contain a bundle of privileges needed for accessing an app or features that are then assigned to users via business roles. This section checks for selected critical business catalogs and their assignment to business roles and users and rates this according to the valuation rules from SAP Note 863362. In case any critical business catalogs are assigned, additional details are presented as sub-chapters.

Business Catalog Assignments Overview Table Example

 

Critical Authorization Combinations

Segregation of duties in SAP Integrated Business Planning (SAP IBP) is supported by the use of business catalogs and business roles. Creatinga a business role by combining catalogs may grant excess authorization to users and lead to a negative impact on your business processes. The section gives user counts where such critical combinations are found, with a link to information on assessing the associated risks.

Communication (Inbound/Outbound)

Certificate-based communication is recommended for technical users involved in inbound/outbound communication. It is usually easier to detect a compromised certificate than to detect a compromised password. This section lists customer-managed communication arrangements that are password-based, and points to recommendations for a certificate-based approach.

Upcoming Certificate Expiration

Certificates with an expiration date in the next 90 days are listed in this section, with alerts for certifcates where a short-term expiration under 30 days is found.
